episode_summary: This episode covers a range of quirky and historical facts, including a man who walked on water for a bet, zebra spiders that chase laser pointers like cats, a historical law requiring chickens to wear clogs, and the surprising celebrity status of Albert Einstein.

facts.fact: In 1907, a man named Charles W. Aldrieve won a huge bet, simply by walking 1,500 miles on water.
Zebra spiders chase laser pointers exactly like a cat does.
According to a law of 1656, chicken owners on the Scottish borders had to give their chickens clogs.
Einstein was so famous that women reportedly fainted in his presence, and a mob once broke down the door of a lecture hall screening one of his films.
